View Menu            Breadcrumbs   Home  Disability and Human Development  Admissions and Programs  PhD in Disability Studies      PhD in Disability Studies  Promoting social justice, self-determination and the full participation of people with disabilities  Disability studies scholars view disability not simply as a defect inside a person, but as a complex relationship between society and people who function differently from the norm.  UIC’s PhD in disability studies program addresses disability in its full complexity, promoting an awareness of disability that supports individuals in shaping their identities and lives . We examine how support services and social and political change can reduce sources of disempowerment.  Disability studies at UIC offers a unique opportunity to study the multilayered, interactional dynamics  of disability.      What sets us apart    Stats and Facts         Advocate for small community living  Tamar Heller argues for the majority of Illinois' institutions for persons with disabilities be closed immediately in "Going Home"          1st  interdisciplinary disability studies PhD program in the country         Excellence  Our award winning faculty, staff and students are being recognized for their achievements and excellence in the field         What to expect   A detailed look at the program           Request info       Arrange a visit       Apply now        Interdisciplinary Experience   Our program is truly an interdisciplinary experience, with faculty, researchers, and students coming from backgrounds in health, education, assistive technology, social sciences and humanities. We recognize the inherent tensions that exist between therapeutic, medical and social models of disability, but acknowledge these differences as fertile ground for the development of disability studies as an integrative knowledge base.     I really benefitted from the interdisciplinary nature of the program, which gave me new ways of understanding and experiencing disability.   Jenna Heffron | PhD ‘16        Your career   Students enroll in our program for a variety of reasons and with a variety of goals for when they graduate, including academic positions, disability policy and advocacy, and visual or performing arts.  A PhD in disability studies gives you advanced knowledge about complex social implications of disability. You’ll develop the skills to lead research, policy analysis, and program evaluation and development in ways that best address the perspectives of people with disabilities. Others have traveled internationally to conduct research, present papers, and participate in service initiatives as they learn how the disability studies knowledge base can expand to incorporate experiences of disability in many cultures.           Drew Egli visits the Wolfensberger Archives  DHD PhD student Drew Egli was provided with the opportunity to visit the Wolfensberger Archives in Omaha as part of a collaboration with the Nebraska UCEDD (the Munroe-Meyer Institute) and the UNMC library.
